incident.message: Not targeting the latest versions of Android; compatibility modes apply. Consider testing and updating this version. Consult the `android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES` javadoc for details.
A newer version of `compileSdkVersion` than 34 is available: 36
A newer version of androidx.core:core-ktx than 1.12.0 is available: 1.16.0
A newer version of androidx.appcompat:appcompat than 1.6.1 is available: 1.7.1
A newer version of com.google.android.material:material than 1.11.0 is available: 1.12.0
A newer version of androidx.constraintlayout:constraintlayout than 2.1.4 is available: 2.2.1
A newer version of com.google.firebase:firebase-bom than 32.7.0 is available: 33.16.0
A newer version of androidx.navigation:navigation-fragment-ktx than 2.7.6 is available: 2.9.1
A newer version of androidx.navigation:navigation-ui-ktx than 2.7.6 is available: 2.9.1
A newer version of androidx.lifecycle:lifecycle-viewmodel-ktx than 2.7.0 is available: 2.9.1
A newer version of androidx.lifecycle:lifecycle-livedata-ktx than 2.7.0 is available: 2.9.1
A newer version of androidx.work:work-runtime-ktx than 2.9.0 is available: 2.10.2
A newer version of androidx.test.ext:junit than 1.1.5 is available: 1.2.1
A newer version of androidx.test.espresso:espresso-core than 3.5.1 is available: 3.6.1

Use of this function is discouraged because resource reflection makes it harder to perform build optimizations and compile-time verification of code. It is much more efficient to retrieve resources by identifier (e.g. `R.foo.bar`) than by name (e.g. `getIdentifier("bar", "foo", null)`).

Use of this function is discouraged because resource reflection makes it harder to perform build optimizations and compile-time verification of code. It is much more efficient to retrieve resources by identifier (e.g. `R.foo.bar`) than by name (e.g. `getIdentifier("bar", "foo", null)`).
It will always be more efficient to use more specific change events if you can. Rely on `notifyDataSetChanged` as a last resort.
